item.description:
Join Imani Mamalution for an informative evening about genetically modified foods and how eating living foods can be one of the best ways to avoid them.   Learn what can we do right here in CT to insure labeling of GMO products.   

Imani owns Alchemy café, a raw, vegan café in Hartford for the past ten years.  And she is the mother of six free-range kids!

Her all organic, GMO-free, gluten-free & living product line will be available for sampling- featuring MamaLicious chocolates, kale chips & nori chips. http://www.mamaliciousmarket.com/

Also, Fire N Spice, a vegan, organic Caribbean restaurant in Hartford, is donating barbecue tofu for the event.  http://www.firenspiceveganrestaurant.com/index.html

*************************************** 

Schedule for the evening:  

7:15 pm: Potluck Dinner begins.

7:45 - 8:30 pm: Talk and Discussion

8:30 pm - 9:30 on:  Hanging out and clean up 

***************************************

About the potluck dinner:

-Many people have dietary restrictions. Be mindful as you prepare your dish, and list the ingredients on a note card at the event. 

 - Please bring your own plate, utensils, and water bottle.  This a zero-waste event. 

***************************************

FREE PARKING!  In back of the ArtSpace building.  Ignore "Resident Parking Only" signs.  Parking is allowed during this event.  Enter through the back entrance by the murals.
item.name: Talk on “Avoiding GMOs by Eating Organic” & Potluck Feast
